wikimediaapiportaloauth-desc: Enables users of the Wikimedia API Portal to create and manage OAuth clients remotely
wikimediaapiportaloauth-ui-client-field-: This is displayed to users of your app during authorization.
To help with the approval process, share a few details about your app.
Server-side app (traditional websites and web server apps)
Client-side or installed app (mobile, desktop, and single-page apps)
Personal API token (for your use only)
I agree to the Wikimedia [[foundation:Special:MyLanguage/Terms_of_Use|terms of use]]. I acknowledge that my API key may be disabled if I violate these terms.
wikimediaapiportaloauth-ui-error-consume: A client with this name is already registered
wikimediaapiportaloauth-ui-client-field-: Users are redirected to this path following successful authorization. [[Documentation/Getting started/Authentication#Choosing_a_redirect_URI|Learn more.]]
wikimediaapiportaloauth-ui-error-request: Request failed. Please try again later.
wikimediaapiportaloauth-ui-client-secret: Save these credentials securely. You won't be able to access them again through the API Portal.
wikimediaapiportaloauth-ui-client-status: Before your client can be authorized by other users, it must be reviewed and approved by Wikimedia OAuth admins.
wikimediaapiportaloauth-email-not-confir: Before you create an API key, please confirm your email address through your [[Special:Preferences|user preferences]].
wikimediaapiportaloauth-page-introductio: Create an API key to start building free knowledge apps. Learn about [[Documentation/Getting started/Authentication|API authentication]] and [[Documentation/Getting started/Rate limits|rate limits]].
